headline.main: WAR DRIVE SPURS UNITY FOR LABOR; Workers Turn to Cooperation to Marshal Every Ounce to Speed the Victory

lead_paragraph: More than ever before in American history are the fortunes of labor tied to those of government. The twelve months that followed Pearl Harbor saw the fruition of governmental labor policies that began with the inception of the New Deal in 1933.
abstract: '41 labor-industry confs, WLB creation, policies and rulings, AFLCIO combined com and wartime problems revd; Murray and Green on labor's stake in war cited
snippet: More than ever before in American history are the fortunes of labor tied to those of government. The twelve months that followed Pearl Harbor saw the fruition of governmental labor policies that began with the inception of the New Deal in 1933....
